QID222.questionText:
Technology Adoption Barriers Survey

Thank you for participating in this research survey. Your insights as a senior leader are invaluable in understanding the dynamics of technology adoption in organizations. This survey will take approximately 10-15 minutes to complete. All responses will be kept confidential and aggregated for analysis. Individual responses will not be identifiable.

By continuing you are consenting to be included in this research study and your survey results data to be used in this research. Participation is voluntary and refusal or discontinuation will involve no penalty. Permission for use of data can be withdrawn for research activities involving the collection and use of identifiable data, although once data is submitted and de-identified in aggregation, withdrawal of individual responses may not be feasible

Primary Researcher: Clarke Moyer, cbm6118@psu.edu

The research goal is to provide research outcomes from this survey every year and enhance the survey to provide long term value to organizations like your own.

QID204.questionText:
Section A: Role and Organization Demographics

Instructions: This first section asks for some background information about your role and your organization. This information is crucial for helping us understand how technology adoption barriers and readiness might differ across various sectors and organization types. Your responses will be aggregated for analysis.

QID223.questionText:
Section B: Perceived Technology Adoption Barriers

Instructions: This section explores factors that may hinder the adoption of new, strategically important technologies. Your candid assessment of these potential barriers within your organization over the past 12 months is vital. Understanding these challenges from your leadership perspective will help identify common obstacles across organizations and inform strategies for more effective technology integration and innovation. Please rate the extent to which each factor has posed a barrier.

Scale:

  • 1 = Not a Barrier

  • 2 = Minor Barrier

  • 3 = Moderate Barrier

  • 4 = Significant Barrier

  • 5 = Major Barrier

  • DK = Don't Know

1.description: Resistance to change among employees or middle management.
1.choiceText: Resistance to change among employees or middle management.

2.description: Lack of support or clear vision from top leadership (including the board, e.g., governing body, oversight committee).
2.choiceText: Lack of support or clear vision from top leadership (including the board, e.g., governing body, oversight committee).

3.description: Organizational culture that discourages risk-taking or experimentation with new technologies.
3.choiceText: Organizational culture that discourages risk-taking or experimentation with new technologies.

4.description: Insufficient skills or expertise within the workforce to utilize new technologies effectively.
4.choiceText: Insufficient skills or expertise within the workforce to utilize new technologies effectively.

5.description: Inadequate training programs for new technologies.
5.choiceText: Inadequate training programs for new technologies.

6.description: High cost associated with acquiring or implementing new technologies.
6.choiceText: High cost associated with acquiring or implementing new technologies.

7.description: Difficulty integrating new technologies with existing legacy systems.
7.choiceText: Difficulty integrating new technologies with existing legacy systems.

8.description: Inadequate IT infrastructure (e.g., network, storage, computing power) to support new technologies.
8.choiceText: Inadequate IT infrastructure (e.g., network, storage, computing power) to support new technologies.

9.description: Difficulty demonstrating clear value (e.g., mission impact, public value, cost-effectiveness) for new technology investments.
9.choiceText: Difficulty demonstrating clear value (e.g., mission impact, public value, cost-effectiveness) for new technology investments.

10.description: Lack of a clear strategy or roadmap for technology adoption.
10.choiceText: Lack of a clear strategy or roadmap for technology adoption.

11.description: Insufficient governance processes for selecting and managing new technologies.
11.choiceText: Insufficient governance processes for selecting and managing new technologies.

12.description: New technologies disrupting existing workflows or processes significantly.
12.choiceText: New technologies disrupting existing workflows or processes significantly.

13.description: Concerns about cybersecurity risks associated with new technologies.
13.choiceText: Concerns about cybersecurity risks associated with new technologies.

14.description: Concerns about data privacy compliance related to new technologies.
14.choiceText: Concerns about data privacy compliance related to new technologies.

15.description: Lack of trust in the reliability or performance of new technologies or vendors.
15.choiceText: Lack of trust in the reliability or performance of new technologies or vendors.

16.description: Uncertainty or complexity related to regulatory requirements.
16.choiceText: Uncertainty or complexity related to regulatory requirements.

17.description: Pressure to adopt technology due to external factors (e.g., mandates, public expectations, peer agency actions), without adequate internal readiness.
17.choiceText: Pressure to adopt technology due to external factors (e.g., mandates, public expectations, peer agency actions), without adequate internal readiness.

18.description: Difficulty finding reliable technology vendors or partners.
18.choiceText: Difficulty finding reliable technology vendors or partners.

QID213.questionText: Please rate the extent to which the following factors have posed a significant barrier to adopting new, strategically important technologies within your organization over the past 12 months.

QID224.questionText:
Section C: Organizational Technology Readiness Assessment

Instructions: This section assesses your organization's current capabilities and preparedness for adopting and effectively leveraging new technologies. Your evaluation of these readiness factors is crucial for understanding the internal strengths and areas for development that influence technology adoption success. These insights can help organizations benchmark their capabilities and identify strategic priorities for enhancing their technological agility and impact. Please rate your organization's readiness or capability in each area.

Scale:

  • 1 = Very Low Readiness/Capability

  • 2 = Low Readiness/Capability

  • 3 = Moderate Readiness/Capability

  • 4 = High Readiness/Capability

  • 5 = Very High Readiness/Capability

  • DK = Don't Know

1.description: Clarity and communication of the leadership's vision for technology adoption and digital transformation.
1.choiceText: Clarity and communication of the leadership's vision for technology adoption and digital transformation.

2.description: Alignment of technology strategy with overall organizational goals and mission objectives.
2.choiceText: Alignment of technology strategy with overall organizational goals and mission objectives.

3.description: Effectiveness of IT governance structures in guiding technology decisions and investments.
3.choiceText: Effectiveness of IT governance structures in guiding technology decisions and investments.

4.description: Openness of the organizational culture to embracing change and new ways of working.
4.choiceText: Openness of the organizational culture to embracing change and new ways of working.

5.description: Extent to which innovation and experimentation with technology are encouraged and supported.
5.choiceText: Extent to which innovation and experimentation with technology are encouraged and supported.

6.description: Availability of personnel with the necessary technical skills to implement and manage new technologies.
6.choiceText: Availability of personnel with the necessary technical skills to implement and manage new technologies.

7.description: Effectiveness of training programs in preparing employees for new technologies.
7.choiceText: Effectiveness of training programs in preparing employees for new technologies.

8.description: Maturity of change management processes to support technology transitions.
8.choiceText: Maturity of change management processes to support technology transitions.

9.description: Adequacy and scalability of the current IT infrastructure (network, cloud, hardware).
9.choiceText: Adequacy and scalability of the current IT infrastructure (network, cloud, hardware).

10.description: Compatibility and interoperability between new technologies and existing systems.
10.choiceText: Compatibility and interoperability between new technologies and existing systems.

11.description: Availability and responsiveness of technical support for technology users.
11.choiceText: Availability and responsiveness of technical support for technology users.

12.description: Maturity of data governance policies and practices.
12.choiceText: Maturity of data governance policies and practices.

13.description: Overall quality and reliability of organizational data used for decision-making and AI/ML models.
13.choiceText: Overall quality and reliability of organizational data used for decision-making and AI/ML models.

14.description: Organization's capability in data analytics and leveraging data for insights.
14.choiceText: Organization's capability in data analytics and leveraging data for insights.

15.description: Maturity and efficiency of business processes potentially impacted by new technology.
15.choiceText: Maturity and efficiency of business processes potentially impacted by new technology.

16.description: Effectiveness of processes for monitoring technology performance and user satisfaction.
16.choiceText: Effectiveness of processes for monitoring technology performance and user satisfaction.

17.description: Adequacy of financial budget allocated for strategic technology adoption and innovation.
17.choiceText: Adequacy of financial budget allocated for strategic technology adoption and innovation.

QID217.questionText: Please rate your organization's current readiness or capability in the following areas related to adopting and leveraging new technologies effectively.

QID221.questionText:
Section D: Maturity Framework Integration (Perceived Maturity)

Instructions: This final section asks you to assess the maturity of key organizational capabilities that underpin successful technology adoption and overall performance. Your strategic perspective is essential for accurately characterizing your organization's current state. By understanding these maturity levels across different organizations, this research aims to develop insights into how varying levels of capability maturity correlate with technology adoption success, barrier mitigation, and overall organizational effectiveness. This can inform the development of targeted strategies for capability enhancement. Please select the statement that best describes your organization's current level of maturity in each area.

Response Scale (5-Levels):

  • Level 1: Initial/Ad Hoc: Processes are unpredictable, poorly controlled, inconsistent, or undocumented. The organization is generally reactive to issues and events. There is little to no formal approach or awareness of the capability area.

  • Level 2: Developing/Repeatable: Basic processes are established for some projects or areas, and may be repeatable, but are not consistently applied across the organization. Documentation is often informal or incomplete. There is some awareness of the capability, but practices are largely reactive or minimally proactive.

  • Level 3: Defined/Standardized: Standardized processes are documented and established across relevant parts of the organization. Processes are generally followed, and there is a proactive approach to managing the capability. Staff have defined roles and responsibilities related to these processes.

  • Level 4: Managed/Quantitatively Managed: The organization monitors and measures process performance and compliance using quantitative data. Capability effectiveness is actively managed, and outcomes are generally predictable. There is a basis for objective decision-making and improvement.

  • Level 5: Optimizing/Innovating: Processes are continuously improved based on quantitative feedback and analysis. The organization focuses on innovation, refining capabilities, and adapting proactively to achieve strategic goals and best practices. There is a culture of continuous improvement and learning.

  • DK = Don't Know

1.description: IT Investment & Value Management: How mature is your organization's approach to selecting, managing, and realizing value from IT investments, ensuring clear alignment with strategic objectives and mission impact?
1.choiceText: IT Investment & Value Management: How mature is your organization's approach to selecting, managing, and realizing value from IT investments, ensuring clear alignment with strategic objectives and mission impact?

2.description: IT-Enabled Organizational Innovation: How mature is your organization's capability to systematically identify, explore, and leverage technology for driving organizational innovation, developing new services/products, or achieving significant operational/mission improvements?
2.choiceText: IT-Enabled Organizational Innovation: How mature is your organization's capability to systematically identify, explore, and leverage technology for driving organizational innovation, developing new services/products, or achieving significant operational/mission improvements?

3.description: Organizational Process Management & Standardization: How mature is the consistency, standardization, effectiveness, and integration of key organizational processes (e.g., project management, service delivery, operational workflows) that are critical for technology adoption and sustained performance?
3.choiceText: Organizational Process Management & Standardization: How mature is the consistency, standardization, effectiveness, and integration of key organizational processes (e.g., project management, service delivery, operational workflows) that are critical for technology adoption and sustained performance?

4.description: Data Governance & Analytics for Decision-Making: How mature is your organization's approach to governing its data assets, ensuring data quality, and utilizing data analytics and business intelligence to inform strategic and operational decision-making and drive improvements?
4.choiceText: Data Governance & Analytics for Decision-Making: How mature is your organization's approach to governing its data assets, ensuring data quality, and utilizing data analytics and business intelligence to inform strategic and operational decision-making and drive improvements?

5.description: Technology Risk & Resilience Management: How mature is your organization's integrated approach to identifying, assessing, proactively managing, and governing technology-related risks (including cybersecurity, data privacy, vendor risks, and operational disruptions) to ensure business resilience and compliance?
5.choiceText: Technology Risk & Resilience Management: How mature is your organization's integrated approach to identifying, assessing, proactively managing, and governing technology-related risks (including cybersecurity, data privacy, vendor risks, and operational disruptions) to ensure business resilience and compliance?

6.description: Strategic IT Planning & Enterprise Architecture: How mature are the processes for developing, communicating, governing, and adapting an overall IT strategy and enterprise architecture that are dynamically aligned with and support the organization's overarching mission, goals, and evolving needs?
6.choiceText: Strategic IT Planning & Enterprise Architecture: How mature are the processes for developing, communicating, governing, and adapting an overall IT strategy and enterprise architecture that are dynamically aligned with and support the organization's overarching mission, goals, and evolving needs?

7.description: Workforce Capability & Talent Development: How mature is your organization's systematic approach to planning for, attracting, developing, retaining, and managing personnel with the necessary skills, competencies, and roles to effectively implement, manage, support, and leverage technology?
7.choiceText: Workforce Capability & Talent Development: How mature is your organization's systematic approach to planning for, attracting, developing, retaining, and managing personnel with the necessary skills, competencies, and roles to effectively implement, manage, support, and leverage technology?

8.description: Change Leadership & Adoption Management: How mature is your organization's capability to effectively lead and manage the complex organizational, cultural, and human aspects of change associated with significant technology adoption, digital transformation initiatives, and new ways of working?
8.choiceText: Change Leadership & Adoption Management: How mature is your organization's capability to effectively lead and manage the complex organizational, cultural, and human aspects of change associated with significant technology adoption, digital transformation initiatives, and new ways of working?

QID220.questionText: Thinking about your organization's typical approach and capabilities in the following areas, please select the statement that best describes your current level of maturity. This assessment helps us understand the sophistication and effectiveness of key organizational practices.

QID226.questionText:
Section E: Final Thoughts & Feedback


Instructions: Your comprehensive perspective is highly valued. This final question provides an opportunity to share any additional thoughts or insights you believe are important for understanding technology adoption challenges, organizational readiness, or capability maturity that may not have been fully captured in the preceding sections (Sections B, C, and D). Your feedback will help enrich the research findings

QID225.questionText: Are there any other significant barriers, readiness factors, or aspects of organizational maturity related to technology adoption that you believe were not adequately covered in this survey? Please elaborate.
